contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} The '''new calendarists''' are those [[Eastern Orthodoxy|Eastern Orthodox churches]] that adopted the [[Revised Julian calendar]], namely the Orthodox churches of [[Ecumenical Patriarchate of Constantinople|Constantinople]], [[Greek Orthodox Church of Alexandria|Alexandria]], [[Greek Orthodox Church of Antioch|Antioch]], [[Church of Greece|Greece]], [[Cypriot Orthodox Church|Cyprus]], [[Romanian Orthodox Church|Romania]], [[Polish Orthodox Church|Poland]], [[Bulgarian Orthodox Church|Bulgaria]], and most of the [[Orthodox Church in America]]. The term is used to distinguish them from those in communion with the New Calendarists who are on the Old Calendar and also the [[Old Calendarists]]. ==References== {{DEFAULTSORT:New Calendarists}} [[Category:Eastern Orthodoxy]] {{Orthodoxy-stub}}
